website_summaries.verdict: These gloves sell for an impressively low price considering the degree of warmth and protection they provide.
pros: Flexible microfiber material, slip-resistant palm, and 3M Thinsulate
These affordable gloves come in three color choices
cons: Although usually true to size, there are occasional complaints about fit

customer_reviews.title: Great ski gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves run true to size. They are super warm and comfy. They clip together which is super convenient. They are water resistant, but not waterproof. After taking quite a few tumbles in the snow while skiing these got wet on the inside, but unless you're rolling in the snow like I was, you will probably be fine. They got wet on only 1 out of 4 ski days. The weather was around 10 degrees F and these were perfect. They were actually too warm for my hands outside of skiing, but that may be because my hands tend to get clammy easily. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are not good for skiing
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are not good for skiing. They will not keep your hands warm in cold weather. Better to spend money on better gloves so you can enjoy your ski trip.
customer_reviews.author: Halle

customer_reviews.title: So warm!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves fit great, and are so warm! I think they'll be great for my upcoming ski trip. The Small fits me perfectly- I'm a 5'6" woman, size 6 ring finger. My hands are normal size, not big by any means. My middle finger is 3 inches long. If you're close to these measurements, they should fit you just fine. Very flexible gloves-Feels like it will be really easy to grip ski poles, tho using a cell phone won't be possible while wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Lissa

customer_reviews.title: Cheap junk!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy these gloves if you plan on doing ANYTHING outside in them. I ordered these for a ski trip this past week and they busted in the first hour of skiing in them and I had soggy wet gloves with plastic hanging out the rest of the day. They were trash after one hour. DO NOT BUY THIS JUNK
customer_reviews.author: Brittney Plummer

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof and would not reccomend for skiing
customer_reviews.text: These are definitely not waterproof. They might be water resistant, but after an hour of ice skating, my hands were wet. I didn’t dunk my hands in water or leave them in the snow, but I did have my hands on the ice a couple times and that was enough for them to soak through. I wouldn’t take these skiing. They weren’t expensive, so i’ll keep them for when i’m In the cold for long periods of time, but not much else. They did fit well and were comfortable and I did appreciate the fleece and ribbed cuff so the cold can’t get in.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Keepers!
customer_reviews.text: This is the third pair of gloves I've bought and they are keepers! They are very lightweight, warm, seemingly waterproof and overall good quality. The fingers are plenty long, which is a problem with some Asian made gloves that have short fingers. Very happy with my purchase, especially considering the price! Recommend...
customer_reviews.author: Christopher W. Burke

customer_reviews.title: Not really waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Initially I really liked these gloves however after an hour of snowblowing they do get wet and soak up water leaving my hands unprotected. It takes quite awhile to dry out the insides and they smell because of that so I have to wash them. I think this coming winter I will try some sort of wet suit like tight glove with something mostly waterproof and bulkier on the outside to protect my hands. Water-resistant, yes, waterproof, no.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonDave

customer_reviews.title: great gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE these gloves! They are extremely well insulated, and stylish! In the cold my fingers always go white--as circulation is poor. With these gloves I never have to worry again. As I finally found a glove that can keep my fingers warm during the freezing tempertures. I have spent so much money trying to find a glove that would actually do its job--as well as protect me in snow, rain anything that may come my way. This glove is perfect. And for the price you absolutely can not beat it--will be buying a lot more pairs! So glad I finally found what I was looking for
customer_reviews.author: smurphie

customer_reviews.title: No difference in size between Med & Lrg
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two pairs of these gloves - one in medium for myself and one in large for my husband ... both pairs of gloves are the exact same size and run small ... one pair will work fine for me (although the length of the fingers is borderline too short), but my husband will not be able to wear the pair I ordered for him as they are too small ... disappointed to say the least. Can't yet vouch for the warmth or water proof material as we haven't worn them out yet, just wanted to let everyone know about the sizing discrepancy. Will be returning the "large" pair.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Sautter

customer_reviews.title: Brrrr
customer_reviews.text: All of the reviews I read about these gloves said they were warm gloves, but I'm not sure those folks live where its cold. The main part of the glove kept my hand warm, but the further out towards my fingertips I went, the colder my fingers got. I am pretty disappointed, but then again, they were pretty inexpensive gloves. So, if you're looking for inexpensive gloves to wear in later fall or earlier spring, you be happy with these. But if you plan on wearing gloves that will keep your hands warm in a little colder climate, you may want to continue looking
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk and Absolute Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: How can these gloves get such high reviews when they're an absolute piece of junk?! My two teenage daughters went on a church retreat this weekend and these gloves ripped on the first day. Sledding was the only outdoor activity in which they participated. I don't understand how holding on to a tube could cause it to rip. Not only is the material cheap, but it didn't even keep their hands warm. These gloves were an absolute waste of money. I'm happy that Amazon gave me a full refund because these gloves are NOT worth even one penny.
customer_reviews.author: ChanceLacee

customer_reviews.title: Do not keep your fingers warm
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves because of their great reviews. However, the gloves do not keep your fingers warm at all. I went out on New Years with them for the first time and it felt as if I had on regular $5 cotton gloves. First review ever written.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle

customer_reviews.title: Women's ripped like all other reviewers Men's are great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the men's Grey and black gloves for my husband and the pink and white ones for myself. The seams ripped out of my pink ones the first day, got a replacement pair and the new ones did the same thing! Trying one more time and then I am calling it quits. My husband's black and Grey ones have gone through multiple uses (I even wore his) and they are made way better than the women's ones..... BUY THE MEN'S!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Size up, not very insulating
customer_reviews.text: First of all, these gloves run WAY too small. I usually have a problem with gloves being too big, so I definitely wasn't expecting a small to feel so tight. I definitely could have gone for a large and that was not something I'd ever expect considering everything always fits too big on me. The gloves are waterproof, but they do not shield well from the cold. I used these on my skiing trip in March, and after about 30 minutes on the mountain, my fingertips went numb.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice long cuffs!
customer_reviews.text: I got these Terra Hiker Winter Gloves two weeks ago. As described, these Gloves not only keep hands warm and dry during outdoor activities, but also fit very well. However I am most satisfied with what is its extended cuffs, not like my old gloves. That effectively prevent chill or snow from entering gloves and helps lock the inside temperature. Furthermore the price is very good! I recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: potato head

customer_reviews.title: Great for Maine winters!
customer_reviews.text: The sizing information was helpful. These gloves were mostly used while I shoveled the driveway. Perfect for extra cold and snowy weather, I would highly recommend the Terra Hiker Waterproof gloves for uses beyond skiing. However, since I did cross-country ski in my youth, I also believe these gloves would've been excellent for skiing. For the price, I'll probably buy another pair should I lose my current gloves.
customer_reviews.author: G. Tomer

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Where I live it was around 10-20 degrees some days during the winter. After changing a tire and some other outdoor actives these became a must have and kept my hands really warm. From the base of my palm to the top of my middle finger is 7.5 inches and these size fit well. Overall really happy with the price and the product.
customer_reviews.author: Some Random Guy

customer_reviews.title: Kept My Hands Warm All Day!
customer_reviews.text: I took these gloves on my ski trip with my family. They were amazing! The fleece on the inside was super soft and extremely warm. I like the extra material down the wrist so that I could put my jacket over it. It made sure I didn't get any snow down my gloves. I was warm and dry the whole trip.
customer_reviews.author: The Fam

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like these gloves
customer_reviews.text: I got these gloves hoping they'd be great for a whole day outside in subzero temps. They are very comfortable and overall kept my hands relatively warm but the fingers got extremely damp through the course of the day and then chilled. They did a great job blocking the wind but they didn't adequately vent out moisture so after about 3 hours, I had damp hands.
customer_reviews.author: Princess Pandora

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves at the price point
customer_reviews.text: I like these gloves! They get the job done for this price point. In comparison to better known brands these do fall short but if you’re looking for something to wear just a few times for that one ski trip your significant other drags you on (even though you don’t know how to ski and will probably never go again), these are the gloves for you!
customer_reviews.author: DJB

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: EVERY time I pull my hands out of the gloves the innner layer gets pulled out too and I have to spend minutes restoring it back to normal. Otherwise it’s unwearable. It’s extremely frustrating especially when your hands get wet when skiing. Very bad design although it looks like decent quality. Also they use some cheap insulation material you can see when opening the zip. All I have to say is you get what you pay for. Spend $15 extra and get a pair that you can actually wear without getting frustrated every time you take them off.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Warm, waterproof, sticky lining
customer_reviews.text: These are definitely warm and waterproof! I’ve worn them for a few snow storms doing snow removal and shoveling. These lasted for more than 12 hours, still dry! The only downside is that the lining tends to stick if your hands are moist, so they’re pretty tough to get back on once your hands get wet. As long as you either leave them on or dry your hands well, these are the best gloves I’ve ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Been Jammin'

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Waterproof gloves...might even be too warm???
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Large version as that is what I normally order as far as gloves go and they fit perfect. There isn't much "free space" in the gloves at all. I LOVE the back vent/pocket area as my hands tend to sweat when I wear gloves. The buckle to keep the gloves together is awesome, so much better than those pesky clips that used to come on gloves. These will work out awesome for my upcoming ski trip in January!
customer_reviews.author: Eric M

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother. Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: If I could give these gloves 0 stars I would. These gloves are look cheap and did an awful job of keeping my hands warm while skiing in Colorado. To make matters worse, the pinky on one of the gloves was stitched inside in a way that made putting your finger in through the finger hole impossible. I had to put both my pinky and ring finger in one hole. SO uncomfortable. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Gaby

customer_reviews.title: As warm as it gets
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great. They are really warm. It gets pretty cold shoveling snow but with these gloves you don’t feel it. I can be outside for several hours shoveling or snow blowing and I don’t feel the cold. If they ever wear out I would certainly buy them again!!
customer_reviews.author: Nanci

customer_reviews.title: Very warm and comfy
customer_reviews.text: This glvoes is very warm and inner layer is very comfortable. Love the softness. It keeps warm and best for winter and especially while cleaning the car it is very comfortable because it is water proof. Overall the quality of these gloves is great. They keep hands warm and comfortable in cold weather. They fit perfectly and proved to be very uncomfortable and cold.
customer_reviews.author: Pradeep

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT Fit, Warmth, Almost Luxurious to Wear
customer_reviews.text: I've been a fan of Thinsulate gloves since they came out. During snow shoveling season, some days I had to take breaks in order to warm my hands using my OLD gloves. These gloves have MORE Thinsulate than traditional gloves. They kept hands toasty warm. As a bonus, they are so cushy, yet flexible too, they are almost luxurious. Nice looking and they fit was as described -- PERFECT.
customer_reviews.author: EmmyT

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Really good quality winter gloves. Highly recommend. Fabric seems strong and water beads up on it. Normal sizing. I chose medium because I don't like super bulky gloves. They're snug, but I prefer that. I'd say my hands area average size so depends on what kind of fit you like.
customer_reviews.author: Grorich

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart right away
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed in these gloves. I wore them to go skiing, and they started coming apart at the seems within an hour of wearing them. I hadn’t even started skiing! Luckily only the outer layer was torn, and the insulation was fine, though sticking out, so I could still wear them all day and my hands were mostly warm. But if I had needed to buy new overpriced gloves from the lodge to make it through the day I would have been seriously pissed.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great! They keep my hands warm for all my winter activities. The only down side is that when my hands are wet they gloves are challenging to get on. They right hand glove has a pocket for hot-hands, and the pairing thing is a buckle so it's super easy (some of my gloves are SUPER difficult to get connected!)
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good gloves for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I have large hands and was concerned these might be too small, but the large size fit pretty comfortably. They are warm and do the job. Good deal at this price. Only negatives are that fingers could be a little more flexible and the drawstring doesnt close the cuff well enough
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Quality came apart the first time I wore them
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these gloves just over a month ago, I didn't need to wear them until this past weekend when we had a snowstorm. I wasn't outside shoveling for more than 30 minutes before I looked down and realized that on my gloves was already coming apart at the seams. The gloves were also WAY to big. which may have been my fault, I could have ordered the wrong size but I know I didn't order a large and these gloves were huge. I would not advise anyone to buy these gloves but if for some reason you do - SIZE DOWN!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Ann Nickerson

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves for the price
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are very soft and comfortable and it's easy to use for ski. However, water resistant material is thinner than most other gloves. The interior is made of cotton. When hands are wet, it is easy to pull out the interior linen and hard to wear without re-organization.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Tu

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: The hubs and I both tested these out! He actually wore them to reach into our pool in 20 degree weather to get something. His hands remained both dry and warm. I wore them today in 14 degree weather and my hands remained warm and toasty. *I was moving the whole time I wore them and was not stationary. They are put together well with strong stitching.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin and Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend. I didn't think I would like the bright ...
customer_reviews.text: Kept my hands very warm in December in Colorado. I highly recommend. I didn't think I would like the bright pink, but I bought them because they were lower priced, and I ended up loving them.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kraus

customer_reviews.title: Not for ski and temperature below 10F
customer_reviews.text: I only ski in green trails and after day 1, the seams on thr right glove already tore and by day 3, glove is not useable. I was in temperature 15F to -5F. These gloves do not keep warm. After 3 days of ski, I have the tossed them. However the price is reasonable for a 3 day use.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Mok

customer_reviews.title: Not a good glove
customer_reviews.text: I bought this glove for my ski trip in March and the inner lining came out as i took out my hand. It was nearly impossible to line up the inner lining with each finger as i placed my hand inside the glove. Very poor manufactured glove.
customer_reviews.author: W.L.

customer_reviews.title: Run small - Medium and Large are same size!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a medium and a large in these gloves and both pairs are the exact same size - too bad they run so small! I can wear one pair (although the fingers in these are short) but my husband will not be able to wear the "large" pair I ordered for him. Can't vouch for the warmth and waterproof material yet as we haven't worn them out. Just beware of poor sizing info!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Sautter

customer_reviews.title: POOR QUALITY!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves because they had great reviews. The positive thing is that they kept my hands warm without making them feel sweaty. While they are not waterproof, my hands did not get wet from them being in and out of the snow that day. I used them for 2 days of skiing - less than 10 hours. I was only on intermediate trails and was not doing any extreme activity with these gloves on. After two days, they were already ripping and frayed at the edges. And one of the hooks ripped off, too. See the attached pictures. I would not recommend these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberlina

customer_reviews.title: Cheap junk
customer_reviews.text: Seams ripping on first day of use, by third day of use you can see they are literallly falling apart at three different seams. Fortunately Amazon offered an immediate refund. Pretty cheap Chinese junk.
customer_reviews.author: psychtobe

customer_reviews.title: Soooo Warm
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought these for my husband. Winter has been going on FOREVER and he needed some waterproof gloves for shoveling. These not only did the trick but they were SO warm and fit perfectly. Highly recommend. Five stars ⭐️
customer_reviews.author: Jsmith27

customer_reviews.title: Too Bulky & too long in fingers
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't wait to get these for NE winters. Sadly, these gloves were too big & bulky. The fingers were way too long for a woman even though I used their sizing chart. Had to return.
customer_reviews.author: Carleenie

customer_reviews.title: Warm and cozy
customer_reviews.text: We are senior citizens and my wife loves these gloves when we take our morning walks during the winter so far a very good product
customer_reviews.author: rcapen

customer_reviews.title: Truly waterproof/snow proof, excellent gloves
customer_reviews.text: Excellent warmth, very useful wrist strap, and most importantly- completely waterproof gloves!! Was making snowballs and slush balls for hours, and my hands were completely dry and toasty with these gloves. Buying another set- my husband had sloggy wet hands from his gloves so I had to share mine😁
customer_reviews.author: Angelaaa

customer_reviews.title: They're gloves and they have space for five fingers each - pretty much what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for the first ski trip I've taken in 25 years. I didn't die - I attribute some small part of that good fortune to the gloves. So there you have it - this purchase may very well save your life!
customer_reviews.author: Ken Stwalley

customer_reviews.title: Nice glove
customer_reviews.text: I am giving 5 stars for the price and quality. I used fir skiing 3 days in a row. I don't think any gloves stays completely dry inside. I would try to dry out a little with blow dryer at night. They served the purpose and the outside stayed dry. I think everyone's hands sweat when skiing.
customer_reviews.author: kimmi

customer_reviews.title: One use only. At least for me
customer_reviews.text: Gloves started to tear apart at both index fingers 2 dys into my ski trip. Had to wear with hand warmers in the gloves to keep hands warm but so did everyone else in my group so maybe the glove did what it was supposed to. 2 stars because they were cute. Looks like pic and matched my ski wear
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Kept Hands Warm and Dry
customer_reviews.text: I brought these for a ski/tubing trip. My hands were still warm and dry after hours of being in the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Shann Elle

customer_reviews.title: Good but not entirely waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and have a nice little pocket on the back, they run a little large but the straps tighten them down well. They are mostly waterproof but not for a whole day of being in the snow, it will soak through eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Rainbows

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have snowboarder with these gloves in ~15-20 degree F weather. They are fantastic. I put hand warmers in the little zippers on the top and my hands never got cold for hours. Would absolutely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie32182

customer_reviews.title: OK for some recreation not to work in.
customer_reviews.text: Have worn them a couple of times. The thumb to palm area is too short and pulls. They are warm and would be a good commuter glove. I have used them a couple of times for snowmobiling and work well. They are not a good glove to work in as they are pretty bulky and the fingers to not have any extra protection.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Lefor

customer_reviews.title: Very nice waterproof glove!
customer_reviews.text: Gloves fit my 9-year old granddaughter just fine. She wears an adult medium. They feel warm and only time will tell if they will hold up to her hyperactivity. I prefer this squeeze clip to keep the pair together during storage.
customer_reviews.author: WXYZ

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof, warm, and durable
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are very well made and really warm. They fit nicely and still allow you to move your fingers and use your hands. The clip together option is nice for when not in use so you can keep them together. They're waterproof and are a really nice pair of winter gloves. I'd recommend to anyone to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Belle Esprit

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, warm
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit, warm, easy to get on and off. Kept my hands warm on the slopes in windy 4 degrees. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Annette C

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves fit perfect did not let snow in and kept my hands warm. Nice and soft on the inside . :) to warm/ dry hands !!!
customer_reviews.author: steve e.

customer_reviews.title: Nice, Waterproof, Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are very nice and very well made. They are indeed waterproof, and well insulated. When skiing, they kept my hands, dry and warm! I would purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: Hope❤️

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these gloves for a ski trip and we also went snowmobiling. They kept my hands warm both days. When everyone complained of having cold fingers, mine were fine! Instagram: monique_pineault
customer_reviews.author: Monique Pineault

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: Great quality gloves. I have been looking for gloves that keep my very cold hands warm while outside and these do. Highly recommend I did feel the cold in these gloves while I was skiing out for a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette

customer_reviews.title: Cute but Not durable for Skiing
customer_reviews.text: Cute gloves but not durable enough for skiing, when putting back on my gloves which was difficult since the inside is cloth and it gets all wet the outer part ripped. Had to but replacement gloves at the ski resort.
customer_reviews.author: Walkes2

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: TERRIBLE quality Tore after 3 days skiing Would never buy again, the seams started to u wind the last day skiing and it lost all waterproof protection
customer_reviews.author: Justin B. Aldred

customer_reviews.title: great gloves
customer_reviews.text: I love to hike and these gloves keep my hands warm dry and very comfortable. They can also be attached to each other so you can't lose a glove.
customer_reviews.author: beth reprince

customer_reviews.title: Not warm enough
customer_reviews.text: These didn’t keep my hands warm in very cold weather. In the 15 minutes that it took to clean up my car after a storm, my finger tips were frigid. Gloves advertised for skiing should be made to handle the cold.
customer_reviews.author: odette

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: They fit my hands perfectly, I have big palms but short fingers. They kept me super warm and completely dry during my ski trip. Great purchase for an even greater price
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Purks

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! So warm and comfy! They will keep my hands warm all winter.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle Hoxie

customer_reviews.title: Great glove for the money.
customer_reviews.text: A perfect fit for our small to med size hands and they are nice and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Martini

customer_reviews.title: FELL APART IMMEDIATELY
customer_reviews.text: These COMPLETELY fell apart during the first use during a ski trip. I’m super disappointed because they are cute gloves and pretty cozy, but seriously terrible quality!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Warm!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome set of gloves for the winter! Water **resistant and warm. I wouldn't call them water proof but as long as you arent getting your hands intentionally wet, these are great. Keeps the warm in!
customer_reviews.author: Sophia Ralli

customer_reviews.title: Perfect winter glove!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great!! Definitely waterproof, really thick insulation to stay warm. I like how it extends at the bottom of the glove to ensure a tight seal. Grips on the palm help with driving, and shoveling. Pretty much the perfect winter glove (:
customer_reviews.author: fayth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect during the recent subzero temps
customer_reviews.text: Extremely warm! Perfect during the recent subzero temps. Shoveled snow for over an hour and never noticed the cold.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonSince1997

customer_reviews.title: NewEngland Weather
customer_reviews.text: We live in New England with snow. These gloves fit my husband and are easy to put on and take off. Since these gloves arrived, it has snowed twice and it has kept his hands warm.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M'Sadoques

customer_reviews.title: Warm and waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Love these, holding up good for light chores and shoveling this winter. Just brush snow off car with my gloved hands sometimes. Adjustable fit makes it super secure. Not as clumsy as i thought with the thickness and cleans up well. So happy i got them!
customer_reviews.author: Alastair Mimsy-Porpington

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these specifically for snow play. They were great. My hands stayed dry and super warm. I would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: great gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I went snowboarding with these and they fit great, and kept me warm! water doesn't get in and they were very resistant!
customer_reviews.author: Stark the Dane

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and warm!
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and warm. Breathable to help keep hands from sweating. Soft and good gripping ability. Great value, especially compared to store brands.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Warm and fit well.
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my husband this winter for our ski trip to Canada. He is happy with them. They fit well and are warm. Perfect for those snowy mountain slopes.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: I do like the gloves
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I do like the gloves. They're keeping warm so far, and I do like the design. However, I would say they're a little on the small side. A little more room would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Tomaszycki

customer_reviews.title: very warm
customer_reviews.text: Warm, bright and easy to find, but very small tear along lateral thumb after 1 month of use (I'll stitch it and it will last years)

customer_reviews.text: Kept hands dry and warm. The size chart is off so go down one size for right fit.

customer_reviews.text: The large is a little big, but these are super warm! Bought them for a ski trip and hubby had no complaints.

customer_reviews.text: Took these gloves to new Mexico and they did their job! Fit nice, soft inside and kept my hands warm and dry.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are very great quality and keep me so warm when I go in the snow.

customer_reviews.title: Best gloves for price on amazon!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Bought these because of positive reviews and I wasn't disappointed. Used them for snowboarding in big bear. Worked excellent ! No problems. My hand were warm the entire time and no water penetration. I couldn't have asked for a better deal.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted three days
customer_reviews.text: After just three days of skiing, seams have come apart in two different locations, with a third one starting. Don't waste your money.

customer_reviews.title: Great price for great gloves!

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for the price
customer_reviews.text: Happy with these gloves. The keep my hands warm and dry while skiing. Also they are not too bulky. Stitching is good quality and hooks work well. Highly recommended.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but not warm
customer_reviews.text: These gloves fit well, and the cuff is generous and protects against wind. They're fine for semi-cold temps, but they are not warm in temps under 30 degrees.

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome waterproof gloves! I wore these skiing and it was raining the entire time. My hands stayed warm and dry! They were very comfortable too. I would recommend!

customer_reviews.title: not waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: These were not in the least bit waterproof. I was drawn in by the price and the look of these gloves, but after a day on the slopes, these did not stay dry enough for my hands. Pretty disappointed, but the customer service is nice

customer_reviews.title: I love these gloves
